definition: (especially of wood) cut or ripped longitudinally with the grain, division of a group into opposing factions, come open suddenly and violently, as if from internal pressure
details:
adjective
- (especially of wood) cut or ripped longitudinally with the grain
= example: (especially of wood) cut or ripped longitudinally with the grain
- having been divided
= synonyms: disconnected
noun
- division of a group into opposing factions
= synonyms: schism
- the act of rending or ripping or splitting something
= synonyms: rent
- extending the legs at right angles to the trunk (one in front and the other in back)
- an increase in the number of outstanding shares of a corporation without changing the shareholders' equity
= example: an increase in the number of outstanding shares of a corporation without changing the shareholders' equity
= synonyms: stock split
- a divided formation of pins left standing after the first bowl in ten-pin bowling
= example: a divided formation of pins left standing after the first bowl in ten-pin bowling
- a dessert of sliced fruit and ice cream covered with whipped cream and cherries and nuts
- an opening made forcibly as by pulling apart
= synonyms: tear
- a lengthwise crack in wood
= example: a lengthwise crack in wood
- a promised or claimed share of loot or money
= example: a promised or claimed share of loot or money
- a bottle containing half the usual amount
verb
- come open suddenly and violently, as if from internal pressure
= synonyms: burst
- separate or cut with a tool, such as a sharp instrument
= synonyms: cleave, rive
- go one's own way
= synonyms: separate
- discontinue an association or relation
= synonyms: break
- separate into parts or portions
= synonyms: split up
